column4: how can I report a bug on something if I don't even know what is at fault!!!?
just document it the best way you can and report it as a general bug or something?
I am trying to follow this ... https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ReportingBugs
well, what's happening wrong?
some notification icons will not respond to being clicked on directly ... like the volume icon for instance
I have to click on the icon to the right of it and slide the cursor over to the left to get the volume, network, BT icons to respond
I believe notification-ar is the executable for the notification-area. maybe try "top | grep notification", which is what I did. what do you think?
what will that command do ?
wait I found it. ps aux | grep notification
/usr/lib/gnome-panel/notification-area-applet
which one?
this is strange. I killed them and got a gnome bug saying it quit unexpectedly and needed to reload. volume and all that responded normally though
what exactly did you kill?
notification-area-applet and gdu-notification-daemon
what do you have?
gdu-notification-daemon
and another one with an ID of 3195 .... but I cannot locate it in System Monitor
well I don't know if it would help but you could try restarting it. I am looking in Add to panel for what controls sound volume and can't find anything at all. Hmm
restarting helps 1 time out of 10 ... tried that a lot ;)
Darn. So your volume control doesn't work at all?
it's not really that ... here is my description https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/783354
what do you think is wrong?
I think I found out what the issue was ... sorta
